content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had this conversation with a potential tenant named Yi-Nuo Wang from China.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of the conversation was the negotiation of the rental price for a 50 square meter one-bedroom unit in the city center.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: Did you agree on a final price? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: If no, why did you not agree on a final price?
name: Evaluator

content: I did not agree on a final price because we did not reach a mutual agreement. The potential tenant, Yi-Nuo, felt that the price was high for an unfurnished apartment of that size in the city center, and I was willing to negotiate but could only go as low as 700 euros.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: Understood. Now, on a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikeable and 10 being very likeable, how would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: [Answer] I would rate the likeability of the negotiation partner, Yi-Nuo Wang, as 8.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: Why did you give that rating? Can you provide some reasons?
name: Evaluator

content: [Answer] I gave that rating because Yi-Nuo was respectful, direct, and clear in expressing his needs and expectations. He was also open to negotiation and showed a good understanding of the market value of the apartment.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: That's good to hear. At any point of the negotiation, did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator
